name: Fujifilm Instax Wide 210 Camera
description:
The Fujifilm Instax Wide 210 is an instant camera by Fujifilm that utilises their unique full sized Fujifilm Instax Wide Film that is just about twice as wide as regular Instax Mini Film. Experience the full joy of instant film just like the old Polaroid 600 film!

The camera features an "intelligent" auto flash that adjusts the flash to different light conditions so that your subjects are not washed out by the flash. The side control panel allows you to control shooting settings at your fingertips and also has an LCD film counter.

Similar to the Instax Mini 25s and Instax Mini 50s, the Instax 210 adjusts shutter speeds automatically, and also comes with an attachable close-up lens.

If you feel the smaller credit card sized photos of the Instax Mini is not enough, the Instax Wide 210 Camera will surely give you the full experience of instant photography at its best!

name: Fujifilm Instax Wide Colour Film (twin pack)
description: The Fujifilm Instax Wide Colour Film is used for the Fujifilm Instax 210 Camera. This contains two packs of film giving you 20 shots of instant photos that is twice as wide as the Instax Mini Instant film! The size of the Instax Wide Film is similar to the Polaroid 600 except it is a little wider. Experience the full joy of instant film with the Fujifilm Instax Wide Film on the Instax 210 Camera!

name: Professor Kobre's Lightscoop
description:
Lightscoop is an ingenious, simple device that turns the normal flash that comes equipped with most SLR's into a pop up style flash, giving effects normally only achieved with pricier add-on flashes. Conventional flashes that come equipped with the camera often give poor and unrealistic lighting to photos as the light shines excessively directly onto the subject being photographed. The Lightscoop creates a more natural looking photo as the light from the flash is bounced up onto the ceiling, recreating a more light source that is more distributed. Dont let your convenient little pop-up flash ruin your photos with evil red eye, ugly shadows, hot spots, bleached out faces, underexposed colors, and blurry movement that exist only in your photographs, not in the real world. The Lightscoop creates soft, natural light and lets you capture the scene the way you see it. This model is compatible with the following cameras:
  • Canon - 35mm dSLR cameras that have a pop-up flash. On some Canon models, it's necessary to slightly back the Lightscoop out of the hot shoe in order for the flash to fire.
  • Fuji - FinePix Pro Series
  • Nikon - 35mm dSLR cameras that have a pop-up flash.
  • Olympus- E420, E520, E3, E620
  • Panasonic Lumix - DMC-G2K
  • Pentax - K-7, KX, K10D, K100D, K20D, K200D
  • Sigma - SD14 Series
Two versions of the Lightscoop are available:
  • Standard - the standard model of the Lightscoop, no added colouring to the flash light
  • Warming - a tinted version of the Lightscoop that gives a warming effect when light bounces off
For more information on configuration of your SLR camera to get the best results with the Lightscoop, visit this page.

name: Minimo-X Digital OMO Camera
description: The Minimo-X Digital Camera is a tiny key-chain camera that packs a ton of features and is capable of creating saturated images with vivid colours and the vignetting effect with the cross-processed film look! The camera has a 3.2 megapixel chip that is capable of shooting both images and video, and uses a MicroSD card (up to 8gb). A free 2gb MicroSD card is included in this package so you can get started snapping as soon as possible!

name: Wanderlust Pinwide Lens for Micro Four Thirds Cameras
description: The Wanderlust Pinwide is a lens attachment that will transform your Micro Four Thirds camera into a digital pinhole camera! It empowers your Micro Four Third camera with the ability to create lofi images with the delicious pinhole smoothness with wonderful vignetting you would expect from analog pinhole cameras. The Pinwide is engineered by Wanderlust with high precision to create images that closely matches the look and feel of traditional analog pinhole photography. With a 11mm (or 22mm equivalent) pinhole providing an ultrawide field of view and infinite depth of field, the Pinwide lets you create incredible near/far shots which would be impossible with a lens. As the makers of Wanderlust put it, it has "All the vintage charm of pinhole, but with a live viewfinder, adjustable ISO, autoexposure and even video." This is certainly a must-have-accessory if you have a Micro Four Thirds Camera!

name: Lucky SHD200 - Color 35mm Film
description: Proudly coming from the same country the Holga was born, Lucky films are a perfect companion for your Holga 135 Series camera or Recesky camera! The SHD200 is an affordable and reliable 35mm 200 ISO Colour Negative Film (36 exposures) at a price that wont hurt your wallet! Note: you can always use 35mm film on your Holga 120 Series camera using our 135 Film Adapter!

name: Agfa Vista 100 - Color 35mm Film
description: AgfaPhoto Vista 100 is a great choice of film for shooting in daylight and sunny conditions. This film produces an abundance of natural colors - at these prices you'd be insane not to pick some of this up to test out!

name: Agfa Vista 400 - Color 35mm Film
description:
AgfaPhoto Vista 400 is a reasonably priced film given it's flexibility in being a suitable film of choice for most light conditions.

It captures fast movements safely on film. Even when conditions are not ideal - you always get great results. 

Start shooting some of this ISO 400 C-41 colour film today!

name: Agfa CT Precisa 100 - Color Slide 35mm Film
description: This ISO 100 Agfa film from AgfaPhoto is slide film that is ideal for shooting in sunshine and also in cloudless skies. If you have been meaning to try out some slide film to see what it's all about then we recommend giving this one a go! This film is also ideal to be cross processed! If you are looking for a suitable film to be cross processed then we definitely recommend giving this film a go.

name: Ferrania Solaris FGPlus 100 - Color 35mm Film
description: Ferrania Solaris film produces bright and saturated colors that will make most scenes that you shoot stand out, giving it an almost retro look. Rated at ISO 100 this Ferrania Solaris 100 film is suitable for daylight shooting. Check out a Lomography user review of this film here!

name: Ferrania Solaris FGPlus 400 - Color 35mm Film
description: Ferrania Solaris film produces bright and saturated colors that will make most scenes that you shoot stand out, giving it an almost retro look. Rated at ISO 400 this Ferrania Solaris 400 film is flexible to shoot allow you to shoot in slightly overcast or cloudy situations.

name: Ferrania Solaris FGPlus 800 - Color 35mm Film
description: Ferrania Solaris film produces bright and saturated colors that will make most scenes that you shoot stand out, giving it an almost retro look. Rated at ISO 800 this Ferrania Solaris 800 film's faster speed will allow you to shoot in situations where you find you may have less lighting.

name: Fujifilm Superia X-tra ISO400 - Color 35mm Film
description:
The Fujifilm Superia range is quite possibly one of the most popular 35mm Colour films used today. It is readily available everywhere, and the balance of quality and cost makes it virtually unbeatable.

The Fujifilm Superia X-tra ISO400 36exp film is an all-round, general purpose film that offers nice skin tones, fine grain and a fairly high speed for outdoors, indoors, with flash and for capturing action.

name: Fujifilm Superia X-tra 800 (135-24) - Color 35mm Film
description:
Fujifilm Superia X-tra 800 is a widely used film and known for its reliability as a high speed film. 

It is a highly versatile film at a decent price making it a film of choice for low light general photography.

Please note, at the time of writing, this is the only 35mm film we are selling that is 24 exposures (instead of the usual 36).

name: Fujifilm Provia 100F RDPIII - Color Slide 35mm Film
description: Fujichrome PROVIA 100F Professional (RDP III) is an ultra-high quality, ISO 100 color reversal film. With the finest grain (an RMS granularity value of 8) among ISO 100 color reversal films and an extremely high sharpness, it captures details with unprecedented clarity, while providing rich gradation, vivid and faithful color reproduction, and well-controlled gradation balance. These characteristics make it an ideal choice for a wide range of subject matter but it is especially ideal for landscape and nature photography.

name: Fujifilm Velvia 100F - Color Slide 35mm Film
description:
Fuji Velvia 100F is a medium-speed (ISO 100) daylight-type color slide film. It achieves world-class color fidelity, reproducing even the most subtle hues due to Multi-Color-Correction-Layer technology. It features high resolution and super-fine grain (RMS 8). This film produces intense color and features super-fine resolution. It is excellent for general photography or any scenario where fine detail is required. The Multi-Color-Correction-Layer technology assures accurate color representation under a wide variety of shooting scenarios. Velvia has a reputation for being a real photographer's film. For those who enjoy rich, luscious color, this is the film to choose.
  • Expiration date of film is 03/2012 or later

name: Kodak E100VS ISO100 - Color Slide 35mm Film
description:
Kodak E100VS Colour 35mm Slide Film is a high quality slide film that captures vivid colours, high sharpness and fine grain. The film is capable of capturing extreme high contrast scenes that is harder to achieve with negative film.

Experiment with slide film and open up a whole new world of vivid and colours in high contrast that became a signature of the Lomography movement!

* Note that slide film is different to negative film in that it uses a different process for developing (or needs to be cross processed)

name: Kodak Gold 100 - Color 35mm Film
description:
The Kodak Gold series of films has proven to be the go to film for all occasions shooting for decades now. 

It is a respected brand for the category it places itself in amongst the cheaper end of colour films available on the market. 

This film is rated at 100 ASA and is suitable for all types of outdoor shooting or indoor photography with a flash.

name: Kodak ColorPlus 200 - Color 35mm Film
description:
Kodak ColorPlus 200 is a basic consumer film. If you are just looking to pop a film into your camera then Kodak ColorPlus is something you can definitely consider! 

Rated at 200 ISO this film is suitable for outdoor sunny photos otherwise a flash is necessary for indoor conditions.

name: Kodak Ektar 100 - Color 35mm Film
description:
Featuring ISO 100 speed, high saturation and ultra-vivid color, Kodak Ektar 100 offers the finest, smoothest grain of any color negative film available today. Ideal for scanning, and offers extraordinary enlargement capability from a 35mm negative. A perfect choice for commercial photographers and advanced amateurs.
  • Expiration date of film is 08/2013 or later

name: Kodak Portra 160 NC - Color 35mm Film
description: Kodak Portra 160 NC film offers natural colors and low contrast to expose the subtle splendors of the moment. It's a film that is ideal for portraiture work. The grain of this film is especially low and the color rendition and saturation and the sharpness of the film is close to exceptional.

name: Kodak Portra 160 VC - Color 35mm Film
description: Kodak Portra 160 VC 35mm film is well known for it's vivid colors (hence "VC"). This film is a great choice for portraiture work. The grain of this film is especially low and the color rendition and saturation and the sharpness of the film is close to exceptional.

name: Kodak Portra 160 (NEW) - Color 35mm Film
description:
The new Kodak Portra 160 film replaces two previously loved Kodak Portra 160 films - the Portra 160 VC and Portra 160 NC. This new Portra 160 delivers amazing tonality and detail. It features a significantly finer grain structure for improved scanning and enlargement capability in todays workflow. This film will deliver exceptionally smooth and natural skin tone reproduction. It's the ideal choice for portrait, fashion and commercial photography whether in the studio or on location. Check out photos shot with this film at the flickr group located here. Grab some of this NEW Kodak Portra 160 in 35mm format and try it out today!
  • Expiration date of film is 08/2013 or later

name: Kodak Portra 400 - Color 35mm Film
description:
The new Kodak Portra 400 is the worlds finest grain high-speed color negative film. At true ISO 400 speed, this film delivers spectacular skin tones plus exceptional color saturation over a wide range of lighting conditions. For years, professional photographers have preferred Kodak Professional Portra films because of their consistently smooth, natural reproduction of the full range of skin tones. In that same tradition, the new Portra 400 Film is the ideal choice for portrait and fashion photography, as well as for nature, travel and outdoor photography, where the action is fast or the lighting cant be controlled.
  • Expiration date of film is 06/2013 or later

name: Kodak Portra 800 - Color 35mm Film
description: Kodak Professional Portra 800 Film is now enhanced to deliver all the advantages of a high-speed film along with finer grain, higher sharpness, and more natural skin tones and color reproduction. Portra 800 Film delivers best-in-class underexposure latitude, with the ability to push to 1600 when you need extra speed. It is ideal for long lenses, fast action, and low light, enabling you to capture shadow details without flash. Portra 800 Film for perfectly stunning results with less-than-perfect light.

name: Kodak Ultramax ISO400 - Color 35mm Film
description: Kodak Ultramax film has many many years of reputation as being a film that is well constructed, reliable and easy to use. This ISO400 film is versatile in that it can be used as a film of choice for many situations. It is a very good general purpose film. Here's what Kodak has to say about their own film: "ULTRA MAX 400 Film is a worry-free, easy-to-use high speed film designed for snap shooters. ULTRA MAX 400 Film gives you the flexibility you need to take consistently better pictures in more picture taking situations, better low-light picture quality with fewer underexposures, better results with zoom lenses, greater flash range, better "stop-action" photos, and reduced impact of camera shake. Even when enlarged, ULTRA MAX 400 Film delivers excellent sharpness and fine grain for crisp, clear pictures. Optimized color precision technology provides consistently bright, vibrant colors with accurate skin-tone reproduction for natural-looking people pictures." Grab some today!

name: Rollei Creative Edition Redbird - Color 35mm Film
description: Rollei has created a set of films specifically for Lomo lovers - calling it their "Creative Edition" of films! The Rollei Creative Edition Redbird selection of films is a 400 ISO speed red scale film. Red scale film refers to the manner in which the red layer of the film is laid on top of the other layers (whereas in other C-41 films it is usually the bottom layer) - the effect is the creation of beautiful deep red tones in images. While the red tones will be the most dominant in your pictures, experiment with slower or longer exposures to see if this will have any effect with the colors in your pictures! This will definitely be one of the films we will be loading into our cameras quite often in the weeks and months ahead! Grab some today... stocks are limited!

name: Rollei Creative Edition Nightbird - Color 35mm Film
description: Rollei has created a set of films specifically for Lomo lovers - calling it their "Creative Edition" of films! The Rollei Creative Edition Nightbird selection of films is a 500-800 ISO speed red scale film. Red scale film refers to the manner in which the red layer of the film is laid on top of the other layers (whereas in other C-41 films it is usually the bottom layer) - the effect is the creation of beautiful deep red tones in images. While the red tones will be the most dominant in your pictures, experiment with under and over exposures to see if this will have any effect with the colors and tones in your pictures! This will definitely be one of the films we will be loading into our cameras quite often in the weeks and months ahead! Grab some today... stocks are limited!

name: Rollei Creative Edition Crossbird - Color 35mm Film
description: Rollei has created a set of films specifically for Lomo lovers - calling it their "Creative Edition" of films! The Rollei Creative Edition Crossbird selection of films is a 200 ISO speed film designed ground up to be cross processed! This film is labelled to be "Proccessed using C-41" - meaning you will have no problems having it processed at your local lab (it shouldn't cost you extra too)! Cross processing of films can sometimes give unpredictable effects, however since this one has been designed to be cross processed, you can be assured of vibrant colors, rich contrast and strong tones in the pictures you get from this film! This will definitely be one of the films we will be loading into our cameras quite often in the weeks and months ahead! Grab some today... stocks are limited! Check out the Flickr galleries for pictures shot using this film.

name: Agfa APX 100 - B&W 35mm Film
description: This film marks the return of the classic traditional black and white film. At 100iso it offers very fine grain and sharpness. Agfa APX 100 is perfect for landscapes and architectural photography. Dated 01/2013.

name: efke kb 25 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
Efke is manufactured by Fotokemika, a company located in Croatia. Efke films are manufactured using classic emulsions with very high silver content. The Efke films are made using the ADOX formulas that were first introduced back in the 1950s.

Efke kb 25 is a slow film ideal for portraiture and landscape work. It is a very fine grain film which becomes especially apparent even when images are rescaled.

name: efke IR820 - Infrared B&W 35mm Film
description: Efke IR820 35mm Black and White Infrared Film is a medium speed infrared film with the same configuration as Maco IR820C film. It is available in several formats up to 4x5" and it features a spectral sensitivity of 820nm. If you use this film with a dark or opaque red filter, you'll find your foliage and clouds go pure white while sky and water will be deep black. The lack of the anti-halation backing will create a halo around your highlights. Note! Testing of this brand new emulsion has shown that best results are obtained by exposing the film at ISO 25 and using an infrared filter such as a Hoya R72, Tiffen #87 or B+W 092. (Standard Red 25A filters are not recommended). Skin tone (warm) and lips reproduce as white Near-infrared results are obtained by exposing the film at ISO 25 with a Red 25A filter. Aperture f/16 Shutter speed 1/30th second Use for pictorial applications, such as architecture, landscape, portraiture

name: Lucky SHD100 - B&W 35mm Film
description: Proudly coming from the same country the Holga is made, Lucky films are a perfect companion for your Holga 135 Series camera or Recesky camera! The SHD100 is an affordable and good quality 35mm 100 ISO film (36 exposures) that produces great black and white photos. Note: you can always use 35mm film on your Holga 120 Series camera using our 135 Film Adapter!

name: Ilford Pan 100 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
ILFORD PAN 100 is a medium speed black and white film which offers outstanding tonal rendition, together with fine grain and high sharpness. 

PAN 100 is suitable for most general purpose indoor and outdoor photography applications where good lighting exists, it is particularly suited to portraiture. 

When processed as recommended PAN 100 produces negatives that allow a high degree of enlargement.

name: Ilford Delta 100 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
The Ilford Delta film range is a high quality black and white film. It is a medium speed, fine grain, black and white film that is ideal for pictorial and fine art photography. It offers exceptional sharpness and high level of detail. The films are capable of producing very smooth and fine grain and precise rendition of tones. The Ilford Delta ISO100 black and white 35mm film is ideal for normal light conditions and offers high quality results between ISO50-ISO200. Fore more info see the Fact Sheet here.
  • Expiration date of film is 06/2014 or later

name: Ilford Pan 400 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
ILFORD PAN 400 is a fast black and white film ideal for action, available light and general purpose photography. 

It has fine grain for its speed and excellent contrast and sharpness combining to give excellent image quality. 

This film has a high degree of exposure latitude, making them easy and reliable to use in difficult lighting conditions

name: Ilford XP-2 Super 400 - B&W 35mm Film (C-41)
description:
Ilford XP2 Super 400 is a sharp, fast and fine grain black and white film. It is also a film that can be processed using the standard C41 development process - meaning that you can take it to most photo labs to have it processed!
  • Easy to expose, and has extremely wide exposure latitude
  • Easy to process; It is a black and white film which is processed in C-41 type processing chemicals
  • Easy to print; Negatives are printed on black and white paper in the same way as conventional black and white negatives XP2 Super is a chromogenic film; This means that the dyes which make up the image are formed during development rather than being present in the film or added later
  • The extremely wide exposure latitude of XP2 Super is the result of the unique relationship between exposure and grain in chromogenic films
  • Expiration date of film is 02/2013 or later

name: Ilford Delta 400 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
A ISO 400 high speed film giving images with extraordinary depth and dimension - Ilford Delta 400 provides an almost unrivalled combination of speed and sharpness with a width of tonal range that retains subtlety and detail. The liberating speed of Delta 400 PROFESSIONAL allows fast action to be frozen, great depth of field, excellent results in low lighting conditions, the freedom of a handheld camera and yet still provides the fine grain and level of detail normally associated with ISO 100 films.
  • Expiration date of film is 06/2014 or later

name: Ilford Delta 3200 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
Ilford Delta 3200 professional allows photographers to take pictures under difficult conditions including fast action and poor lighting. With a measured speed of up to ISO 1250 (up to ISO 1600 when developed in Ilford microphen developer) the film has been designed to be push processed to achieve its nominal speed of EI 3200. It may be further pushed to EI 12,500 with a change of developer, or pulled to provide results equivalent to the best ISO 400 films making it a highly versatile film of choice for professional photographers.
  • For making quality photographs in difficult exposing conditions
  • Wide latitude allows for shooting in a variety of venues
  • Can be push process to even higher settings

name: Ilford FP4+ 125 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
For high quality black and white photography, ILFORD FP4 PLUS is hard to beat. This film has very fine grain, outstanding sharpness and very good contrasts in detail. This makes it a very suitable film of choice whenever a job demands great enlargement or the subject contains a wealth of fine detail. Nominally rated at ISO 125/22, ILFORD FP4 PLUS has become the benchmark against which other medium speed films are judged. With enormous latitude for exposure error above and below its ISO 125, ILFORD FP4 PLUS is very suitable for most photographic subjects under a variety of lighting conditions. For more info, read the Fact Sheet here
  • Expiration date of film is 02/2017 or later

name: Ilford HP5 Plus 400 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
ILFORD HP5 Plus is a fast black and white film. It is ideal for action, available light and general purpose photography. HP5 Plus is compatible with all major processing systems, including those which give the standard short fixing and washing times.
  • Expiration date of film is 12/2015 or later

name: Ilford Pan F Plus 50 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
Ilford PAN F PLUS in 35mm format at ISO 50 is the slowest of the ILFORD films. This film is ideal for landscape photography while still suitable as a film of choice for subjects ranging from architecture to still-life and portraiture to medical. When you can afford to shoot at a slower film speed, the image quality, fine detail and lack of grain you can gain out of choosing this film will more than compensate. It has outstanding resolution, sharpness and edge contrast. For more info read the Fact Sheet here.
  • Expiration date of film is 01/2014 or later

name: Fomapan 100 - B&W 35mm Film
description: Fomapan 100 is often compared to the now discontinued Agfa APX 100 film - a once very much loved film. This film produces images of fine grain with a wide tonal range which you will find pleasing to the eye. For the price Fomapan 100 35mm comes in at, you would be mad not to grab some and try it out! Check out the specification sheet for more information available here. Check out the Fomapan Flickr galleries for more pictures shot using Fomapan.

name: Fomapan 200 Creative - B&W 35mm Film
description: Fomapan 200 is a well regarded versatile film, with characteristics of the highly regarded Fomapan 100 film. A film that can produce pictures of great tonality, this film is hard to go by at what it's priced at! Pick up some Fomapan 200 Creative 35mm and try it for yourself today! Check out the specification sheet for more information available here. Check out the Fomapan Flickr galleries for pictures shot using Fomapan.

name: Fomapan 400 Action - B&W 35mm Film
description: Fomapan 400 Action is a panchromatically sensitized, black and white negative film designed for taking photographs under unfavourable light conditions or using short exposure times. The film meets high requirements for low granularity, good resolving power and good contour sharpness. Check out the specification sheet for more information available here.

name: Fujifilm Acros ISO100 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
The Fujifilm Acros film is a reliable black and white film that offers a high tolerance for exposure in different lighting conditions. This means the results are less likely to be too bright or too dark.

The Fujifilm Acros ISO100 black & white 35mm film is capable of producing fine detail and good quality grains at a reasonable price.

name: Fujifilm Neopan 400 Professional - B&W 35mm Film
description:
Neopan 400 Professional is a high speed, black-and white negative film with an ISO speed of 400. The incorporated silver halide particles have been rendered much finer than before while light absorption efficiency has also been greatly increased. The film offers extraordinary sharpness, fine grain, and wide exposure latitude. In spite of its high speed this film yields quality prints
  • Push processing capability to EI 1600
  • Highly resistant to static marks
  • Provides adequate in-camera transport, smoothness and flexibility

name: Kodak Plus-X 125 - B&W 35mm Film
description: When you want the crisp whites, even grays, and the density of true black to blossom, Kodak Plus-X 125 Black and White Film delivers. Plus-X 125 Film offers a combination of sharpness and fine grain that makes it the ideal film for beautifully printable negatives in moderate-to-bright light.

name: Kodak T-Max 100 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
The worlds finest-grained 100-speed black-and-white film, T-MAX 100 lets you explore the extremes of image quality and enlargement with nearly invisible grain. And its high resolving power and incredible sharpness satisfy even the most detail-obsessed artist. Worlds finest-grained 100-speed B&W film
  • Extremely high sharpness
  • Very high resolving power
  • Optimal for enlargement

name: Kodak T-Max 400 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
Kodak Professional T-Max 400 Film is one of the the sharpest 400-speed black and white film available today. 

With superb grain and nice resolving power for details, this is a film of choice for many photographers around the world.

name: Kodak T-Max P3200 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
The Kodak T-Max P3200 is a professional black & white 35mm format film that has a multi-speed capability - meaning it can be pushed between about ISO 800 up to ISO 25000. This allows you to take photographs with high sharpness even in very low light conditions!
  • Expiration date of film is 08/2014 or later

name: Kodak Tri-X 400 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
Kodak Professional Tri-X 400 Films are high-speed panchromatic films that are a great choice for photographing dimly lighted subjects or fast action, for photographing subjects that require good depth of field and fast shutter speeds, and for extending the distance range for flash pictures. Tri-X offers a lush tonal scale and is capable of capturing a huge exposure range. With the proper developer, you can rate it from 200 to 1600 ASA, and still get good results. Over the past 50 years, Tri-X has been and still is, the black and white stock that photojournalists and artists swear by. It is almost certain, that more famous shots have been taken with this stock, than any other in the history of film.
  • Expiration date of film is 12/2014 or later

name: Kodak BW400CN - B&W 35mm Film (C-41)
description: Kodak Professional BW400CN film is a multi-purpose 400-speed black-and-white chromogenic film designed for processing in color negative chemistry (c41 process) and printing on color negative paper. This film is intended for exposure with daylight, electronic flash, and artificial illumination. You can also obtain pleasing results under other light sources, i.e. illumination in stadiums, without using filters. This film offers extremely fine grain in a professional chromogenic film. The end result is a smooth, neutral tone image with outstanding highlight and shadow detail.

name: Rollei Ortho 25 - B&W 35mm Film
description:
The Rollei Ortho 25 film is a black & white 35mm format film with a low ISO of 25/15. It can be pushed up to two f-stops depending on development.

The film offers extraordinary sharpness and excellent fine grain and is suitable for daylight and tungsten light conditions.

name: Rollei Retro 80S - B&W 35mm Film
description: The Rollei Retro 80S is a fine grain, black & white 35mm format film ideal for general purpose and fine art photography.

name: Rollei Retro 100 - B&W 35mm Film
description: Rollei Retro 100 is a classic panchromatic black and white film, ideal for a whole number of uses. It is a great general purpose film which produces prints with sharp tones with wonderful contrast for classic black and white photography. This film is actually the final production of Agfa APX100 - a once very much popular film that created a final batch in 2005! Stored in -18 degree temperatures, it is now re-released under the Rollei brand as Rollei Retro 100. Grab some to try it out for yourself today!

name: Rollei Retro 100 Tonal - B&W 35mm Film
description:
The Rollei Retro 100 Tonal is a black & white 35mm format film with a medium speed of ISO 100. The film is a general purpose film with fine grain, excellent sharpness and good contrast.

For best results with fine grain, high contrasts and tonal range, Rollei suggests over-exposing the film by about one stop, and processing the film in a lower speed developer (using ISO 50 with the Retro 100).

name: Rollei Retro 400S - B&W 35mm Film
description:
The Rollei Retro 400S 35mm film is an efficient and reliable black & white 35mm format film with a high speed of ISO 400, allowing you to shoot in less than ideal lighting conditions.

For best results with fine grain, high contrasts and tonal range, Rollei suggests over-exposing the film by about one stop, and processing the film in a lower speed developer (using ISO 200 with the Retro 400S).

name: Rollei RPX 100 - B&W 35mm Film
description: Rollei RPX 100 film is a traditional fast speed B&W film. It is more suitable for working with outdoor photography (portrait or nature) or indoor photography with good suitable lighting. The film has fine grain and has a broad tonal range with good contrast. Check the data sheet for more information regarding this film.

name: Rollei RPX 400 - B&W 35mm Film
description: Rollei RPX 400 film is a traditional fast speed B&W film. It is a good choice and suitable for working with general indoor and outdoor photography applications. The film has fine grain and has a broad tonal range with good contrast. Check the data sheet for more information regarding this film.

name: Fujifilm Reala ISO100 - Color 120 Film
description:
The Fujifilm Reala film is a reliable colour negative film that offers bold and accurate colours, like the name suggests. The Fujifilm Reala ISO100 colour 120 film is capable of producing good detail and sharpness with smooth grains for a range of lighting conditions.
  • Expiration date of film is 03/2013 or later - please note that Fujifilm Reala is now a discontinued film from Fujifilm meaning the stock we have left is likely going to be on of the last remaining stocks available and it will be hard for us to replenish this when this sells out.

name: Fujifilm Astia 100F - Color Slide 120 Film
description: Fujichrome Astia 100F Professional (RAP 100F) is an ISO 100 daylight-type color reversal film for professional use. This film boasts smooth and natural skin tone reproduction from the highlights to the shadows and exceptionally fine grain of RMS*granularity 7. These characteristics provide the film with one of the world's highest levels of color fidelity, making it an ideal film of choice for professional photography.

name: Fujifilm Provia 100F RDPIII - Color Slide 120 Film
description:
Fujichrome PROVIA 100F Professional (RDP III) is an ultra-high quality, ISO 100 color reversal film. With the finest grain (an RMS granularity value of 8) among ISO 100 color reversal films and an extremely high sharpness, it captures details with unprecedented clarity, while providing rich gradation, vivid and faithful color reproduction, and well-controlled gradation balance. These characteristics make it an ideal choice for a wide range of subject matter but it is especially ideal for landscape and nature photography.
  • Expiration date of film is 11/2013 or later

name: Fujifilm Velvia 50 ISO50 - Color Slide 120 Film
description: The Fujifilm Velvia 50 is a 120 format slide film that allows you to achieve high quality photos with excellent colour saturation and vibrancy in your photos. The film is ideal for daylight conditions and can provide excellent results when push/pull processing between -0.5 stop to +1 stop.

name: Fujifilm Velvia 100 - Color Slide 120 Film
description:
Fujifilm Velvia 100
  • ISO 100 - At ISO 100, Fujichrome Velvia 100 provides a more useful speed for greater flexibility in varied shooting situations.
  • Ultra-high-saturated color reproduction
  • Super-fine grain
  • Improved color stability
  • Improved versatility
    • Expiration date of film is 07/2013 or later

name: Fujifilm Velvia 100F - Color Slide 120 Film
description: Fuji Velvia 100F is a medium-speed (ISO 100) daylight-type color slide film. It achieves world-class color fidelity, reproducing even the most subtle hues due to Multi-Color-Correction-Layer technology. It features high resolution and super-fine grain (RMS 8). This film produces intense color and features super-fine resolution. It is excellent for general photography or any scenario where fine detail is required. The Multi-Color-Correction-Layer technology assures accurate color representation under a wide variety of shooting scenarios. Velvia has a reputation for being a real photographer's film. For those who enjoy rich, luscious color, this is the film to choose.

name: Kodak Ektacolor Pro 160 - Color 120 Film
description:
The Kodak name needs no introduction. The Ektacolor Pro 160 is a 120 colour film perfect for your Holga 120 Series camera to provide impressive results! The film is capable to producing strong blues, deep reds with a nice warm yellow tint. 

The Ektacolor Pro has an ISO of 160 suitable for shooting on sunny days. For night time or indoor settings, use long exposures or shoot with a Colour Flash for nice, smooth detail!

This film is ideal for new comers and beginners to the Holga scene. We recommend you start with cheap films first to get the hang of your Holga before you progress to more expensive films!

name: Kodak Ektar 100 - Color 120 Film
description:
Featuring ISO 100 speed, high saturation and ultra-vivid color, Kodak Ektar 100 120 Film offers the finest, smoothest grain of any color negative film available today. Ideal for scanning, and offers extraordinary enlargement capability from a 35mm negative. A perfect choice for commercial photographers and advanced amateurs.
  • Expiration date of film is 09/2014 or later

description: The new Kodak Portra 160 film replaces two previously loved Kodak Portra 160 films - the Portra 160 VC and Portra 160 NC. This new Portra 160 delivers amazing tonality and detail. name: Kodak E100VS ISO100 - Color Slide 120 Film
description:
The Kodak E100VS Colour 120 Slide Film is a high quality slide film that captures vivid colours, high sharpness and fine grain. The film is capable of capturing extreme high contrast scenes that is harder to achieve with negative film. Experiment with slide film and open up a whole new world of vivid and colours in high contrast that became a signature of the Lomography movement! * Note that slide film is different to negative film in that it uses a different process for developing (or needs to be cross processed)
  • Expiration date of film is 01/2014 or later

description: Rollei has created a set of films specifically for Lomo lovers - calling it their "Creative Edition" of films! name: Shanghai GP3 - B&W 120 Film
description:
Shanghai GP3 120 film is a great 120 black and white film that makes for a perfect match for the Holga 120 Series cameras! At a fraction of the price of other 120 B&W film in the market, it allows you to create amazing photos from the Holga without having to go bust! Try one out today!
  • Expiration date of film is 08/2013 or later

name: Lucky SHD100 - B&W 120 Film
description:
Proudly coming from the same country the Holga is made, Lucky films are a perfect companion for your Holga 120 Series camera! The SHD100 is an affordable and good quality 100 ISO 120 film that produces great black and white photos ideal for beginners and experimenting with new techniques and effects!
  • Expiration date of film is 05/2012 or later

name: Ilford Pan 400 - B&W 120 Film
description:
The Ilford Pan range is a not as well known within the Ilford range. The Pan 100 and Pan 400 films are based on the well respected Ilford FP4+ and HP5+ emulsions. While the quality of the Ilford Pan range doesn't live quite up to the high standards, the quality is still very good for the price it comes at. ILFORD PAN 400 is a fast black and white film ideal for action, available light and general purpose photography. It has fine grain for its speed and excellent contrast and sharpness combining to give excellent image quality. This film has a high degree of exposure latitute - one and half stops under to as much as five stops over, making it easy and reliable to use in difficult lighting situations. If you have been considering stepping up to the next level of Black and White films, then we highly recommend to this film!
  • Expiration date of film is 06/2012 or later

name: Ilford FP4+ 125 - B&W 120 Film
description:
For high quality black and white photography, ILFORD FP4 PLUS is hard to beat. This film has very fine grain, outstanding sharpness and very good contrasts in detail. name: Ilford Delta 400 - B&W 120 Film
description:
An ISO 400 high speed film giving images with extraordinary depth and dimension - Ilford Delta 400 provides an almost unrivalled combination of speed and sharpness with a width of tonal range that retains subtlety and detail. The liberating speed of Delta 400 PROFESSIONAL allows fast action to be frozen, great depth of field, excellent results in low lighting conditions, the freedom of a handheld camera and yet still provides the fine grain and level of detail normally associated with ISO 100 films.
  • Expiration date of film is 07/2014 or later

name: Ilford Delta 3200 - B&W 120 Film
description:
Ilford Delta 3200 professional allows photographers to take pictures under difficult conditions including fast action and poor lighting. With a measured speed of up to ISO 1250 (up to ISO 1600 when developed in Ilford microphen developer) the film has been designed to be push processed to achieve its nominal speed of EI 3200. It may be further pushed to EI 12,500 with a change of developer, or pulled to provide results equivalent to the best ISO 400 films making it a highly versatile film of choice for professional photographers.
  • For making quality photographs in difficult exposing conditions
  • Wide latitude allows for shooting in a variety of venues
  • Can be push process to even higher settings
  • Expiration date of film is 06/2014 or later

name: Ilford HP5 Plus 400 - B&W 120 Film
description: ILFORD HP5 Plus is a fast black and white film. It is ideal for action, available light and general purpose photography. HP5 Plus is compatible with all major processing systems, including those which give the standard short fixing and washing times.

name: Ilford XP-2 Super 400 - B&W 120 Film (C-41)
description:
Ilford XP2 Super 400 is a sharp, fast and fine grain black and white film. It is also a film that can be processed using the standard C41 development process - meaning that you can take it to most photo labs to have it processed!
  • Easy to expose, and has extremely wide exposure latitude
  • Easy to process; It is a black and white film which is processed in C-41 type processing chemicals
  • Easy to print; Negatives are printed on black and white paper in the same way as conventional black and white negatives XP2 Super is a chromogenic film; This means that the dyes which make up the image are formed during development rather than being present in the film or added later
  • The extremely wide exposure latitude of XP2 Super is the result of the unique relationship between exposure and grain in chromogenic films
  • Expiration date of film is 12/2013 or later

name: efke r 25 - B&W 120 Film
description:
Efke is manufactured by Fotokemika, a company located in Croatia. Efke films are manufactured using classic emulsions with very high silver content. The Efke films are made using the ADOX formulas that were first introduced back in the 1950s.

Efke r 25 is a slow film ideal for portraiture and landscape work. It is a very fine grain film which becomes especially apparent even when images are rescaled.

name: efke IR820 - Infrared B&W 120 Film
description:
Efke AURA IR820 120 Black and White Infrared Film is a medium speed infrared film with the same configuration as Maco IR820C film. It is available in several formats up to 4x5" and it features a spectral sensitivity of 820nm. If you use this film with a dark or opaque red filter, you'll find your foliage and clouds go pure white while sky and water will be deep black. The lack of the anti-halation backing will create a halo around your highlights. Note! Testing of this brand new emulsion has shown that best results are obtained by exposing the film at ISO 25 and using an infrared filter such as a Hoya R72, Tiffen #87 or B+W 092. (Standard Red 25A filters are not recommended). Skin tone (warm) and lips reproduce as white Near-infrared results are obtained by exposing the film at ISO 25 with a Red 25A filter. Aperture f/16 Shutter speed 1/30th second Use for pictorial applications, such as architecture, landscape, portraiture
  • Expiration date of film is 03/2013 or later

name: Fomapan Classic 100 - B&W 120 Film
description:
Fomapan 100 is often compared to the now discontinued Agfa APX 100 film - a once very much loved film. This film produces images of fine grain with a wide tonal range which you will find pleasing to the eye. For the price Fomapan 100 120 comes in at, you would be mad not to grab some and try it out! Check out the specification sheet for more information available here. Check out the Fomapan Flickr galleries for more pictures shot using Fomapan.
  • Expiration date of film is 01/2014 or later

name: Fomapan 200 Creative - B&W 120 Film
description: Fomapan 200 is a well regarded versatile film, with characteristics of the highly regarded Fomapan 100 film. A film that can produce pictures of great tonality, this film is hard to go by at what it's priced at! Pick up some Fomapan 200 Creative 120 and try it for yourself today! Check out the specification sheet for more information available here. Check out the Fomapan Flickr galleries for pictures shot using Fomapan.

name: Fomapan 400 Action - B&W 120 Film
description: Fomapan 400 Action is a panchromatically sensitized, black and white negative film designed for taking photographs under unfavourable light conditions or using short exposure times. The film meets high requirements for low granularity, good resolving power and good contour sharpness. Check out the specification sheet for more information available here.

name: Fujifilm Acros ISO100 B&W 120 Film
description:
The Fujifilm Acros film is a reliable black and white negative film that offers a high tolerance for exposure in different lighting conditions. This means the results are less likely to be too bright or too dark.

The Fujifilm Acros ISO100 black & white 120 film is capable of producing fine detail and good quality grains at a reasonable price.

*Note: This film is a black & white "negative" film, which means it can be processed normally at photo labs.

name: Kodak T-Max 100 - B&W 120 Film
description: The worlds finest-grained 100-speed black-and-white film, Kodak T-MAX 100 lets you explore the extremes of image quality and enlargement with nearly invisible grain. And its high resolving power and incredible sharpness satisfy even the most detail-obsessed artist.

name: Kodak T-Max 400 - B&W 120 Film
description: Kodak Professional T-MAX 400 is an incredibly sharp and fine grain for it's high speed. When you are in need of just that extra little bit of speed for a low light or fast action shot, then this film is a great choice as you can depend on it to still capture that level of detail you may be after. For more info, read the Fact Sheet here.

name: Kodak Tri-X 400 - B&W 120 Film
description:
Kodak Professional Tri-X 400 Films are high-speed panchromatic films that are a great choice for photographing dimly lighted subjects or fast action, for photographing subjects that require good depth of field and fast shutter speeds, and for extending the distance range for flash pictures. Tri-X offers a lush tonal scale and is capable of capturing a huge exposure range. With the proper developer, you can rate it from 200 to 1600 ASA, and still get good results. Over the past 50 years, Tri-X has been and still is, the black and white stock that photojournalists and artists swear by. It is almost certain, that more famous shots have been taken with this stock, than any other in the history of film.
  • Expiration date of film is 12/2014 or later

name: Rollei Ortho 25 - B&W 120 Film
description:
The Rollei Ortho 25 film is a black & white 120 format film with a low ISO of 25/15. It can be pushed up to two f-stops depending on development.

The film offers extraordinary sharpness and excellent fine grain and is suitable for daylight and tungsten light conditions.

name: Rollei Pan 25 - B&W 120 Film
description: Rollei Pan 25 is a panchromatic sensitised black & white film with low speed ISO 25/15. Besides the excellent fine grain this film has a very good resolving power and a high edge sharpness. Rollei Pan 25 is characterised by a high sensitivity reserve of one f-stop, depending upon development. The thin section document emulsion is poured onto a highly transparent base and offers extraordinary sharpness and the finest grain. ROLLEI PAN 25 achieves the highest image quality with very large scales of magnification. Check out the specification sheet for more information available here.

name: Rollei Retro 80S - B&W 120 Film
description: The Rollei Retro 80S is a fine grain, black & white 120 format film ideal for general purpose and fine art photography.

name: Rollei Retro 100 Tonal - B&W 120 Film
description:
The Rollei Retro 100 Tonal is a black & white 120 format film with a medium speed of ISO 100. The film is a general purpose film with fine grain, excellent sharpness and good contrast.

For best results with fine grain, high contrasts and tonal range, Rollei suggests over-exposing the film by about one stop, and processing the film in a lower speed developer (using ISO 50 with the Retro 100).

name: Rollei Retro 400S - B&W 120 Film
description:
The Rollei Retro 400S 120 is an efficient and reliable black & white 120 format film with a high speed of ISO 400, allowing you to shoot in less than ideal lighting conditions.

For best results with fine grain, high contrasts and tonal range, Rollei suggests over-exposing the film by about one stop, and processing the film in a lower speed developer (using ISO 200 with the Retro 400S).

name: Rollei RPX 100 - B&W 120 Film
description: Rollei RPX 100 film is a traditional fast speed B&W film. It is more suitable for working with outdoor photography (portrait or nature) or indoor photography with good suitable lighting. The film has fine grain and has a broad tonal range with good contrast. Check the data sheet for more information regarding this film.

name: Rollei RPX 400 - B&W 120 Film
description: Rollei RPX 400 film is a traditional fast speed B&W film. It is a good choice and suitable for working with general indoor and outdoor photography applications. The film has fine grain and has a broad tonal range with good contrast. Check the data sheet for more information regarding this film.

name: Rollei Infrared 400 - Infrared B&W 120 Film
description: Rollei Infrared 400 film is well suited for experimental, creative applications, and for scientific photography. Perfect exposures can be reached, using special infrared filters, leading into results with an unusual tonal range. Important: The emulsion is coated onto a transparent synthetic base providing excellent long-term and dimensional stability. This film has to be loaded into the camera and unloaded in subdued light. Before and after exposure, always store the film in the black light-tight film container. Not following this procedure may cause light infiltration through the base material to the exposed pictures. Please take care in handling the film in keeping the film roll tight with two fingers after breaking the unexposed adhesive label. The same procedure should be followed after taking the roll film out of the camera. The exposed film should be immediately stored back into the black light-tight film container.

name: Fomapan 100 4x5 inch
description: Fomapan 100 Classic 4x5 inch is a panchromatically sensitized, black-and-white negative film designed for taking photographs Meets high requirements for low granularity, high resolving power and contour sharpness and a wide range of halftones. Fomapan 100 Classic has a nominal speed rating of ISO 100/21 but due to its wide exposure latitude the film gives good results even when overexposed by 1 EV (exposure value) (as ISO 50/18) or underexposed by 2 EV (as ISO 400/27) without any change in processing, i.e. without lengthening the development time or increasing the temperature of the developer used. To make prints or enlargements, Extrabrom and Fomaspeed type enlarging papers are recommended; however, all sorts of black-and-white enlargement papers can be used. Each pack contains 50 sheets

name: Fujifilm FP-100C Professional Color Instant Film
description: Fuji Instant Color Film FP-100C is a peel-apart-type instant color film with an ISO speed rating of 100. Its ability to produce photos of superb quality makes this film ideal for a wide range of commercial uses, including product photography requiring long exposures, microphotography, CRT image recording, and of course identification and portrait photography. This film, in regular size, can be used in cameras and other photographic equipment that accept instant film with a photo size of 85 x 108mm, and those provided or fitted with an instant camera back. One pack takes 10 exposures.

name: Fujifilm FP-100B Professional B&W Instant Film
description: Fuji FP-100B Professional Instant B&W Film ISO 100 is an instant 3.25 x 4.25" peel-apart black-and-white pack film that demonstrates high-quality, sharpness and resolution (daylight type). Uses include cameras and other photographic equipment that accept instant film with a photo size of 85 x 108mm, and those provided or fitted with an instant camera back (e.g. Fuji Instant Back PA-1) and Fuji Instant Holder PA-145.

name: Fujifilm FP-3000B Professional B&W Instant Film
description: This is a 10 sheet box of FP-3000B Professional Instant Black & White Film from Fujifilm. It is a high-quality, fine grained, sharp, instant black-and-white film. Its ISO rating of 3000 makes it perfect for low-light scenarios.

name: Polaroid 600 Film
description: We have a very special limited stock release of the original Polaroid 600 film made by Polaroid, the original masters of instant film technology. Although this film has an expiration date of 09/09, analogue film lovers will surely find a place for this film whether it be as a piece to keep in their own private collection or to experience it first hand by shooting it in their Polaroid 600 cameras. We have a full box of 60 of this classic beauty (minus one box which we kept to ourselves :)). Tests on a single box within this batch have given great results considering the age of the film (see sample pictures 2 and 3 above). We believe this film is still very suitable for shooting for some time yet if kept in a good storage conditions (low temperatures, but not frozen). This film is suitable for use in all Polaroid 600 series cameras. Note: Due to the nature of this film having expired in 2009, we can not give guarantees on this product. No warranty, exchanges or refunds will be accepted for this item. Please keep this in mind before making a purchase of this item. Any questions on the product are welcome via our Contact page.

name: TIP PX70 Color Shade Push (Polaroid Sx-70 Film)
description: Take those Polaroid Sx-70 cameras back out! The Impossible Project's "PX-70 Push!" film brings instant film back to life and gives you the chance to once again produce lovely Polaroids that have captured so much attention in analogue photography through the years. Although PX-70 Push! is still a very experimental film, it is already the second batch of films released after extensive development, succeeding The Impossible Project's earlier release of "PX-70 First Flush" films. This film has peculiar characteristics: it has a pinkish tint, that has an ongoing chemical reaction with the material still being sensitive to light up to two minutes after the shot has been taken! The chemical reaction continues even days after the picture has been taken! PX 70 Color Shade PUSH! Is suitable for all Polaroid SX 70 camera models such as the Land Folding Model (1, 2 and 3), OneStep Rainbow, Pronto, Amigo, Sear Special and more! It is not suitable and not recommended for Polaroid 600 models. For Polaroid 600 models check TIP have also released PX680, which is also available in our shop.

name: TIP PX70 Color Shade (Polaroid Sx-70 Film)
description: This PX-70 Color Shade film is the result of months of hard work by The Impossible Project team. It is the successor to their earlier First Flush and Push films and without a doubt has become known to be much more stable in comparison to their "beta" films. The Impossible Project PX70 Color Shade film has a relatively higher film speed (light sensitivity) in comparison to the previous versions - rated at around 300 ISO. This actually means that it may be a film suitable for both SX-70 and Polaroid Type 600 cameras! For use in Polaroid SX-70 cameras adjust the lighten/darken wheel or slider to the darkest position. For use in Polaroid type 600 cameras adjust the lighten/darken wheel or slider to a lighter setting. As with all other Impossible Project films, the first few seconds when the film is ejected after taking a shot are critical - the picture must be shielded away from light! Follow this easy tip and we think you will be impressed with the colors and details this film can produce! Check out this Impossible Project video for more information on this tip to get the best possible results whether you are shooting it from your Polaroid SX-70 camera or Polaroid Type 600 camera. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films!

name: TIP PX70 Color Shade COOL (Polaroid Sx-70 Film)
description: The latest film from The Impossible Project is definitely COOL in all respects. The new PX70 Color Shade COOL range of films exhibit their latest advancements in instant film production. This film has improved color fidelity, higher contrast, tones and saturation. For long lasting premium results store unopened film packs in the fridge around 5-10C. Please do not freeze the film! As the camera ejects the picture, do IMMEDIATELY shield it from light (e.g. with your hand, a darkslide, shoot into a box, etc...) - the first half second is crucial! Due to the high filmspeed of this material we recommend adjusting the lighten/darken wheel or slider of your camera 1/3 into the dark setting. This film is suitable for all Polaroid Sx-70 series cameras and produces 8 photos from one pack of film. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films!

name: TIP PX100 Silver Shade (Polaroid Sx-70 Film)
description: PX 100 Silver Shade film is Impossible Project's latest development of B&W film for SX-70 Polaroid cameras. This innovative film features a new and special UV filter coating which improves the performance of the film's black & white tones, contrast and picture stability. This new PX 100 UV+ film is optimized for use in SX-70 but slightly faster (more light sensitive) than traditional SX-70 film. It is recommend to adjust the lighten darken wheel of your SX-70 camera 1/3 - 2/3 to the dark setting. PX 100 Silver Shade Is suitable for all Polaroid SX 70 camera models such as the Land Folding Model (1, 2 and 3), OneStep Rainbow, Pronto, Amigo, Sear Special and more! It is not suitable and not recommended for Polaroid 600 models. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films!

name: TIP PX100 Silver Shade COOL (Polaroid Sx-70 Film)
description: The latest film from The Impossible Project is definitely COOL in all respects. The new PX100 Silver Shade COOL range of films exhibit their latest advancements in instant film production. This range of films has improved color contrasts and tones. For long lasting premium results store unopened film packs in the fridge around 5-10C. Please do not freeze the film! name: TIP PX600 Silver Shade UV+ (Polaroid 600 Film)
description: The Impossible Project breathes life into Polaroid 600 cameras once again with their PX-600 Silver Shade UV+ edition of films which is designed for use in all Polaroid 600 cameras! Although PX-600 Silver Shade UV+ is still a very experimental film, it is already part of the second batch of films released after extensive development, succeeding The Impossible Project's earlier release of "PX-600 Silver Shade First Flush" films. PX 600 Silver Shade UV+ is a monochrome film however it's prints have a characteristics that range with colors from black and white to sepia! This film is suitable for all Polaroid 600 series cameras and produces 8 photos from one pack of film. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films!

name: TIP PX600 Silver Shade UV+ Black Frame
description: The Impossible Project breathes life into Polaroid 600 cameras once again with their PX-600 Silver Shade UV+ edition of films which is designed for use in all Polaroid 600 cameras! The Black Frame version of this film means that each photo is framed in full black colour instead of the traditional white frame. Although PX-600 Silver Shade UV+ is still a very experimental film, it is already part of the second batch of films released after extensive development, succeeding The Impossible Project's earlier release of "PX-600 Silver Shade First Flush" films. name: TIP PX680 Color Shade First Flush (Polaroid 600 Film)
description: The Impossible Project breathes colors and brings life back into Polaroid 600 cameras once again with their PX-680 Color Shade First Flush edition of films which is designed for use in all Polaroid 600 cameras! The First Flush Edition of the PX 680 Color Shade film is Impossibles first, experimental color material for type 600 cameras and introduces a magical new color palette within the classic white frame. Even though this is the first release, the general feedback is that this film is stable and bound to please! Being First Flush material this PX 680 FF material will show variances in color balance, in saturation and in contrast. Images may also show a light dot shaped pattern in the dark areas. One pack of PX 680 Color Shade First Flush Edition delivers 8 uniquely colorful images and works in all Polaroid 600 cameras, as well as all SX 70 cameras equipped with an ND filter. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films!

name: TIP PX680 Color Shade Gold Edition (Polaroid 600 Film)
description: The Impossible Project breathes colors and brings life back into Polaroid 600 cameras once again with their PX-680 Color Shade First Flush edition of films which is designed for use in all Polaroid 600 cameras! The First Flush Edition of the PX 680 Color Shade film is Impossibles first, experimental color material for type 600 cameras and introduces a magical new color palette within the classic white frame. Even though this is the first release, the general feedback is that this film is stable and bound to please! Being First Flush material this PX 680 FF material will show variances in color balance, in saturation and in contrast. Images may also show a light dot shaped pattern in the dark areas. One pack of PX 680 Color Shade First Flush Edition delivers 8 uniquely colorful images and works in all Polaroid 600 cameras, as well as all SX 70 cameras equipped with an ND filter. This version of the PX680 film sports a sexy Gold Frame around the picture instead of the regular white border. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films!

name: TIP PZ600 B&W Spectra Film
description: The Impossible Project breathes life into Polaroid cameras once again with their PZ-600 Silver Shade UV+ edition of films which is designed for use in all Polaroid Image / Spectra / 1200 cameras! PZ 600 Silver Shade UV+ is a monochrome film however it's prints have a characteristics that range with colors from black and white to sepia! This film is suitable for all Polaroid Image / Spectra / 1200 series cameras and produces 8 photos from one pack of film. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films! Please Note: packaging for this product has been damaged - the outer casing for the product is easily prone to breakage.

name: TIP PZ680 Color Shade Spectra Film
description: This new addition from The Impossible Project will breath amazing colors into your Polaroid Spectra cameras. The PZ 680 Color Shade film is suitable for use in all Polaroid Spectra/Image cameras. Using their latest chemical formulas which have proved successful so far in their other editions of Color Shade film, they have adapted it for use in Polaroid Spectra cameras. As with all other Impossible Project films, the first few seconds when the film is ejected after taking a shot are critical - the picture must be shielded away from light! Follow this easy tip and we think you will be impressed with the colors and details this film can produce! Check out this Impossible Project video for more information on this tip to get the best possible results out of your Polaroid Spectra camera! This film is suitable for all Polaroid Image / Spectra / 1200 series cameras and produces 8 photos from one pack of film. Important: Make sure you check out the Impossible Project's guides for their films if you are new to these films!

name: TIP Polaroid Image Softtone Edgecut
description:
The Impossible Project breathes life into Polaroid cameras once again with their Softtone Edgecut edition of films which is designed for use in all Polaroid Image / Spectra / 1200 cameras!

The Polaroid Image Softtone Edgecut Film is a colour integral film suited for a variety of light conditions! This film is now expired and was made in very limited numbers. Each pack produces 8 images. Follow the instructions included with the packaging for best results!

name: R09 One Shot B&W Film Developer
description: R09 ONE SHOT is a B&W Film developer that is created according to the much loved Rodinal developer formula. It is characterised by very good contour sharpness and high emulsion speed yield. The subject contrast can be inuenced by varying the dilution of the concentrate. Mixing: 1 part concentrate to 25 or 50 parts water at a temperature of 20 C. Shelf life: The concentrate remains usable for at least 6 months once the bottle has been opened if the screw top is tightly closed. When diluted for use, R09 ONE SHOT only keeps for a short time and therefore should only be mixed immediately before use. Developing times: 20 C Dilution 1 + 25 or 1 + 50 (Small tank processing). Agitation: Small tanks - continuously for the rst minute, and then tilt every 30 seconds
